name: Core Loop
description: Prove the build cycle works end-to-end. After this PRD, /ralph can reliably execute tasks through the architect→implement→review cycle. Human checkpoint: Does the loop actually work? Can I trust it to run on real tasks?

tasks.description: Test and refine the /ralph skill end-to-end. Run /ralph on a small test PRD (NOT a bootstrap PRD — create a dedicated 2-3 task test PRD). Verify: subagents dispatch correctly via Task tool, architect/implementer/reviewer cycle produces actual output, task state updates, .ralph-tasks/ gets populated, circuit breaker works if reviewer keeps rejecting, signoff gates work ('architecture' signoff stops after architect phase). Fix issues discovered.
tasks.outcome: /ralph can be invoked, dispatches subagents, progresses through the build cycle, and handles both happy path and circuit breaker
tasks.verification: Successfully complete at least one task from a test PRD using /ralph. Also trigger a circuit breaker and a signoff gate to verify they work.

tasks.description: Validate spec review gate and progress.txt conventions in practice. The spec reviewer was elevated from an optional role to a defined gate (step 0 in build-cycle.md). This task validates that it actually works: run a spec review on the test PRD from task 001. Intentionally include a vague criterion and verify the reviewer catches it. Also verify progress.txt gets populated correctly during the build cycle with timestamped, per-role entries. Adjust conventions based on what actually works.
tasks.outcome: Spec review gate works as a process step. Progress.txt conventions are validated and refined from real usage.
tasks.verification: Spec review produces actionable feedback on at least one task. Progress.txt contains coherent per-role entries from a completed build cycle.

tasks.description: Document and implement branch/push hygiene for ralph executions. How does ralph name branches? How does it handle existing branches? What happens if multiple PRDs run concurrently? Produce a clear convention and update ralph.md if needed. Keep it simple — one branch per PRD execution is probably enough.
tasks.outcome: Branch naming convention documented. Ralph creates and pushes branches correctly.
tasks.verification: Run /ralph and verify it creates a properly named branch, makes clean commits, and pushes successfully.
